description: Numbers n such that n concatenated with n-1 is a square.
comments: Every term contains even number of digits. - Max Alekseyev, May 14 2007If n=(10^m-1)^2+1 where m is a positive integer then n is in the sequence. Because n has 2m digits and n concatenated with n-1 is n*10^(2m)+(n-1)=(10^(2m)-10^m+1)^2. Take m=1 we get 82 the first such term. - _Farideh Firoozbakht_, Aug 22 2013
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Feb 15 2000.
extensions: More terms from Max Alekseyev, May 14 2007
